page.title: 05A VISIT TO SAVILL GARDENS 2
page.content: Different plants are grown every year so there is a different scenery and the visitors dont get bored with the same thing.The oldest tree in the park is the oak and its age goes up to about 700 years and over.They charge Â£1.50 for adults,Â£1.30 for a coach load,Â£1.00 for old age pensioners and children get in free .The garden is open all year round even though not many people attend the garden in Winter.Many animals live in the park like badgers,foxes,rabbits,squirrels, birds,ducks and the Red Deer.Many students from the College work studying for a job.All retired members who have been working for over 10 years are housed and well looked after.Savill Gardens also has a shop and they plants,guides,maps and books.
